Container.Name: aria4webui
Container.Overview:
The aim for this project is to create the worlds best and hottest interface to interact with aria2. Very simple to use, just download and open index.html in any web browser.
8083 14.8
Container.Description:
The aim for this project is to create the worlds best and hottest interface to interact with aria2. Very simple to use, just download and open index.html in any web browser.
8083 14.8

Config.Name: Aria2 - Secret
Config.Description: Aria2 RPC Secret

Config.Name: Download Storage Path
Config.Description: Container Path: /download

Config.Name: Aria2 WebUI Port
Config.Description: Container Port: 80

Config.Name: Aria2 RPC
Config.Description: Container Port: 6800

Config.Name: Aria2 - Max Concurrent Downloads
Config.Description: Set the maximum number of parallel downloads for every queue item.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Listen Port
Config.Description: Set TCP port number for BitTorrent downloads. Multiple ports can be specified by using ,, for example: 6881,6885. You can also use - to specify a range: 6881-6999. , and - can be used together: 6881-6889,6999. You also need to change the Variable

Config.Name: Aria2 - DHT Listen Port
Config.Description: Set UDP listening port used by DHT(IPv4, IPv6) and UDP tracker. Multiple ports can be specified by using ,, for example: 6881,6885. You can also use - to specify a range: 6881-6999. , and - can be used together. You also need to change the Variable

Config.Name: restart
Config.Description: 容器 Variable: restart

Config.Name: Aria2 - LogLevel
Config.Description: Set log level to output.

Config.Name: User ID
Config.Description: ID of the user the application runs as.

Config.Name: Group ID
Config.Description: ID of the group the application runs as.

Config.Name: Config Storage Path
Config.Description: Container Path: /conf

Config.Name: Aria2 - Listen Port (aria2.conf)
Config.Description: Set TCP port number for BitTorrent downloads. Multiple ports can be specified by using ,, for example: 6881,6885. You can also use - to specify a range: 6881-6999. , and - can be used together: 6881-6889,6999.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Enable DHT
Config.Description: Enable IPv4 DHT functionality. It also enables UDP tracker support. If a private flag is set in a torrent, aria2 doesn’t use DHT for that download even if true is given.

Config.Name: Aria2 - DHT Listen Port (aria2.conf)
Config.Description: Set UDP listening port used by DHT(IPv4, IPv6) and UDP tracker. Multiple ports can be specified by using ,, for example: 6881,6885. You can also use - to specify a range: 6881-6999. , and - can be used together.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Save Session Interval
Config.Description: Save error/unfinished downloads to a file specified by --save-session option every SEC seconds. If 0 is given, file will be saved only when aria2 exits.

Config.Name: Aria2 - BT Require Crypto
Config.Description: If true is given, aria2 doesn’t accept and establish connection with legacy BitTorrent handshake(\19BitTorrent protocol). Thus aria2 always uses Obfuscation handshake.

Config.Name: Aria2 - BT Min Crypto Level
Config.Description: Set minimum level of encryption method. If several encryption methods are provided by a peer, aria2 chooses the lowest one which satisfies the given level.

Config.Name: Aria2 BT Save Metadata
Config.Description: Save meta data as “.torrent” file. This option has effect only when BitTorrent Magnet URI is used. The file name is hex encoded info hash with suffix “.torrent”. The directory to be saved is the same directory where download file is saved. If the same file already exists, meta data is not saved. See also --bt-metadata-only option.

Config.Name: Aria2 - BT Load Saved Metadata
Config.Description: Before getting torrent metadata from DHT when downloading with magnet link, first try to read file saved by --bt-save-metadata option. If it is successful, then skip downloading metadata from DHT.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Continue
Config.Description: If the previous transfer is made by a browser or wget like sequential download manager, then use --continue option to continue the transfer.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Min Split Size
Config.Description: aria2 does not split less than 2*SIZE byte range. For example, let’s consider downloading 20MiB file. If SIZE is 10M, aria2 can split file into 2 range [0-10MiB) and [10MiB-20MiB) and download it using 2 sources(if --split >= 2, of course). If SIZE is 15M, since 2*15M > 20MiB, aria2 does not split file and download it using 1 source. You can append K or M (1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). Possible Values: 1M -1024M

Config.Name: Aria2 - Split
Config.Description: Download a file using N connections. If more than N URIs are given, first N URIs are used and remaining URIs are used for backup. If less than N URIs are given, those URIs are used more than once so that N connections total are made simultaneously. The number of connections to the same host is restricted by the --max-connection-per-server option. See also the --min-split-size option.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Max Connection Per Server
Config.Description: The maximum number of connections to one server for each download.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Seed Ratio
Config.Description: pecify share ratio. Seed completed torrents until share ratio reaches RATIO. You are strongly encouraged to specify equals or more than 1.0 here. Specify 0.0 if you intend to do seeding regardless of share ratio. If --seed-time option is specified along with this option, seeding ends when at least one of the conditions is satisfied.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Seed Time
Config.Description: Specify seeding time in (fractional) minutes. Also see the --seed-ratio option.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Disable IPv6
Config.Description: This is useful if you have to use broken DNS and want to avoid terribly slow AAAA record lookup.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Force Save
Config.Description: Save download with --save-session option even if the download is completed or removed. This option also saves control file in that situations. This may be useful to save BitTorrent seeding which is recognized as completed state.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Max Download Limit
Config.Description: Set max download speed per each download in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted. You can append K or M (1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). To limit the overall download speed, use --max-overall-download-limit.

Config.Name: Aria2 - Max Overall Download Limit
Config.Description: Set max overall download speed in bytes/sec. 0 means unrestricted. You can append K or M (1K = 1024, 1M = 1024K). To limit the download speed per download, use --max-download-limit option.
